meanings.definition: Write or draw carelessly or hastily.
meanings.sent1: I like to scribble in my notebook when I'm bored.
meanings.sent2: The child would often scribble on the walls with crayons.
meanings.sent3: She tried to scribble a note to her friend, but it was too messy to read.
meanings.sent4: His mind was racing so fast, he could only scribble down a few words on the paper.
meanings.sent5: The artist would scribble furiously, creating beautiful abstract designs.

meanings.definition: A piece of writing or drawing done carelessly or hastily.
meanings.sent1: The teacher found a scribble on the back of the test paper.
meanings.sent2: The notebook was filled with doodles and scribbles.
meanings.sent3: The cat walked across the wet paint, leaving a tiny scribble behind.
meanings.sent4: The old book was filled with scribbles in the margins, telling a secret story.
meanings.sent5: The child proudly showed off their scribble, a masterpiece in their eyes.
